page.title: 01Kingswood District. Avon.
page.content: Kingswood District is about 18 square miles in area and lies on the eastern edge of{Bristol.}It is mainly residential, with a{population}of about 87,000. There are also a number of small{industries}such as printing and engineering,as well as those manufacturing footwear and foodstuffs. A few farms amd market gardens may also be found. Evidence can still be seen of the now abandoned{coal-mining}industry for which Kingswood was once famous, and the many chapels are a legacy of the 18th century religious revivals. Today, Kingswood is a popular residential area for people working in Bristol. It has a good shopping centre and is quite well supplied with amenities relating to health, education and leisure. It became part of the county of{Avon}in 1974.
